column2: 13-18 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$1$4$I love that it worked for me and helped prevent any future seizures for my epilepsy
column3: but I got a couple of the weirdest side effects from this medication not even listed on here. One of the symptoms I had that I know that were already reported included anxiety and sometimes depression
column4: but the strangest one I had was very irrational and violent behavior
column5: and I'm not talking about typical and common temper tantrums
column6: as I was only 9 years old taking this; this behavior of mine included actual tantrums out of nowhere and with no apparent cause
column8: playing violent online games while laughing at it
column9: and casually talking about death at the dinner table--all without me realizing doing it. I've even attempted to run away from home and cause self-harm on myself. Luckily
column10: my mom immediately got me off this medication. At the time
column11: I was also showing obvious signs of autism
column13: I am now considered on the spectrum--higher functioning. I know what happened to me back then
column14: and I know it sounds like fiction just from a drug causing all this odd behavior
column15: but it happened. It still scares me to this day
column16: and I don't know what the heck triggered it
column17: but at least I need to know it's all in the past and over with. The only thing I'm still concerned about it is exactly WHAT caused this rare behavior
column18: but I'm not trying to think about it too much. I know this drug has been giving some patients behavior problems
column19: but mine was definitely weird and abnormal behavior. Wouldn't recommend this for anyone who is likely to have a mood/other mental problems.

column3: It has worked really well for me.

column1: 2$Condition: Other$10/14/2015 11:07:46 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$2$It was a pill so ease of use was typical.  Not a huge horse pill but not small and extremely simple to swallow.  I walked in docs office and within 1 minute of me being in the room she decided to prescribe this medication.  She did not test me and non of my tests in my 47 years of life mentioned me being bipolar.  At the time I was on low dose of generic adderal.  I was actually feeling good.  Seeing this doc was at the request of family doc to regulate anxiety meds. I expressed my discomfort vehemwntly... she was condescending and demanded I give it a try.  I have been all screwed up since.  While taking the Depakote I hade mega migraines
column3: totally ignored my daughter and the rest of my life... I did not care.  I was depressed.  My acid reflux that had completely gone away while on the affexor was back in spades.  Also was my diarhia.  My skin crawled like something was trying to get out.  I heard things that were not there.  My dreams were all kinds of scary to creepy.  These symptoms started slow and just got worse and worse.  I let the doc know
column4: her answer was always to give it time.  My family doc and pharmacist stayed that after two weeks I should see improvement not feeling worse more and more.  When I had 2 or 3 pills left from the 30 day bottle I had had enough... I hated missing so much time with my daughter among other things.  The doc had one of her nurses call me and tell me to continue with these pills again and I told the nurse that I was not continuing. She said she would talk to doc..and when she got back with me the nurse said the doc really wanted me to continue.  I said I am not seeing her again I want to see another doc.  I quit taking them started feeling so very much better almost immediately but it has been about 6 months and I still feel some residual affects.  What did this medication do to me?  I am scared.

column3: can't... Only answered q.2 b/ci it was required. Would very much like to know if this would-be a good candidate for treating my manic episodes. Usually in fits and spurts
column4: a good estimate would be 6 manic episodes per year max. They are however
column5: lengthy and a pain to my husband and son as well
column6: that they endure somehow... I take klonapin in a small dose every day as a means to help my mind wind-down and generally relax enough to fall asleep within 30 min or less rather then the 2-3 hours it normally can take. I also take fiorinal w/ codeine to combat stress-related migraines I suffer from at least once per week. I take that only when headache/migraine persists. What might be the best prescription drug to add to this carefully concocted cocktail of medications so far.
